intro: Trachydium kopetdagense, commonly known as the Kopetdag lichen, is a crustose lichen that grows on rock surfaces in arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Caloplacaceae and is characterized by its dark, leathery thallus. The species is notable for its ability to survive in extreme environmental conditions, including high temperatures and low moisture. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role. Trachydium kopetdagense is primarily found in Central Asia, particularly in the Kopetdag region of Turkmenistan and Iran.
